content: I think this is a typical pressured release as dictated by senior management in order to beat the Australian release of Shell Fill Up & Go (the beating of shell to the market is an assumption on my part but I have no doubt my insinuation is for a similar reason if not the stated one). It works but it's loaded with bugs. I registered using PayPal, this went ok. First issue experienced was with the SMS verification - I could enter the code but there was no button to press to submit it. The enter key on they keyboard was non functional, only requesting the code be re-sent presented the 'verify' button. I did not use the 'find a store' feature as the map was not centralised on my general location (or Australia for that matter lol), I just searched for the store I was at when there. Being available I was able the select a pump and have it unlocked when I submitted the request. Filled the car and returned to it, checked the status of the app the see an 'unknown error' pop-up. The app returned the original screen asking what I wanted to do. I was unsure of whether or not I would be chased down for non payment (and secretly was hoping I got a free tank for my testing!) until a PayPal email a minute or so later confirmed my purchase. It has the potential but needs a much larger and extended pilot group to iron out these issues BEFORE being published. This is an Alpha release, Beta at best - something I would expect to be released from first time developer excited to see his first dollar, not a multi-million, multinational corporation like BP. Either re-evaluate your contracted app developers or bring your senior management back down to earth.
replyContent:
Hi Michael,
We’re aware of some people encountering issues with the app and are working to fix these. Regarding your other feedback, we appreciate you taking the time to review the app in detail and will pass on your comments to the rest of the team.
Cheers

Cheers

content: The new update today has fixed the forever-spinning-circle-on-load issues I had on my Galaxy Note 8. It now loads much faster and starts looking for my location successfully.  The app works well, but it looks like there is still a lot of manual interaction from the shop assistant with respect to releasing the pump on BPme's say-so, and then acknowledging that you've finished with the pump before BPme bills you.  I've waited several minutes between hanging up the pump and for the app to confirm I've paid, which can be longer than just walking into the shop and paying the traditional way. No doubt this situation will change over time when BPme is trusted to do it all automatically.  I think overall the concept is great, and no one else has anything like it. Thumbs up and looking forward to future updates!  EDIT Feb 2018: The latest update has brought back the forever-spinning-circle on load again. Even worse is that when I lock my phone and then unlock it to provoke the PIN number, it now tells me that my PIN is wrong! I can reset it via the emailed link which allows me in that one time, but then when I next fill up, it tells me that PIN is wrong again!! Come on guys, test your changes before pushing them out please.
replyContent:
Hi Jeff,
Thanks for your update and we're sorry to hear you had this experience. We are looking into this further to understand what caused this and we really want it to work for you! If you send an email to aucustcare@bp.com with details about what’s not working, we’ll ask our BPme team to lend a hand.
Cheers

content: DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS APP!  Tried it for the first time at bp east brisbane (stanley st). Massive fail. First 2 attempts it timed out while trying to start.   3rd attempt error message sauing log in failed. Took a long time to load.   4th attempt said it was fine to fill up. After filling up and hopping into car service station attendant is waving his arms around and calling out. I check the app. Payment failed error msg.   I take my baby out of car and pay inside (reason i tried this app was to be able to not disturb a sleeping baby).  Service station attendant confirms to me app doesnt work and its not yet ready. Guess i wasn't the  only one he's had to chase down.  Extremely disapointed with this app. Far too many bugs and clearly not ready for launch. A very poor user experience asnd likely last time to use it.  Also make it so you can link your velocity card to the app. The velocity points  benefit is the only differentiator for me to want to go to bp. If i cant use it on the app i wont use the app, or will just go to any other servo.  Lastly there are too many steps to log in. Make it a simple 4 digit pin (this is good enough for banking apps) then go straight to the pump number. It needs to be 2 or 3 steps max from opening the app to being done. You have over complicated it.  Thanks  Thanks for the response. To be clear my concerns were with app and did not relate the the guy at the service station. I ws not suggesting that he did anything inappropriate, just trying to do his job with a system that doesn't work. All he did was confirm for me what i just learnt (and it apears every user of this app by the scroll through these reviews). That is, the app was launched without adequete testing and does does not work. Just want make that clear for thhe area manager investigating my poor experience with he app.
replyContent: Hi Scott, thank you for your clarification. Appropriate action just means further training for the sites CSR's. We are still working to further optimise the app in future releases.

content: First time with kids in the car ,downloaded the app,The app worked great strait away first time quick and easy.  Thanks for reply and making me aware of a different app for bp plus members so I can use my bp card

BP has a dedicated app for BP Plus card holders, called ‘BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme’ which has unique features and benefits for our BP Plus card customers to save time and manage fuel expenses. You can read more about the' BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme' here: https://www.bp.com/en_au/australia/products-services/bpme/bpme-for-bp-plus.html

content: Great app especially when I'm refueling the rental car at the airport. You don't have to line up inside with the rest of the chumps. replyContent:
Hi Greg,
Thank you, we're so happy to hear that BPme is helping you refuel faster and easier. Thanks again for your feedback!
Cheers

content: Surely there has to be an easier way to log in quickly than the way we currently have to ... why do I have to give email, password and answer to secret question everytime? Having a passcode doesn't work either because apparently everytime I key in the one I've registered it's not correct
replyContent: Hi Nyarlu, as BPme requires a payment method to be loaded into the app, we want to ensure the information is protected. You need to add your PIN every time you open the app. If you log out of the app completely, you'll need to put in your password and answer the security question next time you log back in.

content: They have a few bugs to iron out but it works, eventually. Like others have indicated, upon opening the app (having not used or for a month) it did ask for my email login details and then again for my PIN. It was incorrect so I had to reset it. You need to close the app completely and login all over again. But once all done, it only now asks for my PIN. Like a most banking apps, once registered, one should only have to only their PIN. Payment and then receipt delivery was efficient.
replyContent: Hi there, thank you for the feedback, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits. We’re continuously working with our developers to ensure the user experience is optimum and we’re exploring new innovation to bring to market this year.

content: My first time using the app, spent 10 minutes setting it up with paypal only to have payment declined. App told me to drive on and bp would be in touch to arrange payment. Then later got a sms with link to make payment with $3 recovery fee included. Will never use again. Paypal said payment was refused by my bank because it was flagged as suspicious. What dodgey payment gateway is BP using that a bank would flag it as suspicious and block it?
replyContent: Hi Kurt, we have been advised that certain financial institutions do not pre-approve cards for eCommerce purposes. We suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions relating to this.

content:
Always getting error when trying to fill up Got error - sorry we can't seem 
to unlock your pump Have tried 3 times
The app wouldn't even started. Only blank white screen appeared.

Tried to sign up for this app. At first the only option I was offered was 
to change my password, only after repeated attempts did I get to a 
different screen where I had to confirm my phone number. Then I had to 
create a security question, and next a PIN. It's where I decided to pull 
the plug and uninstalled the thing. Why do I need to link this app to my 
PayPal account, create yet another password AND a PIN. Wouldn't surprise me 
if the next question would have been for my fingerprints and a retinal 
scan. Takes less faffing about to sign up for a banking app or PayPal.

When futurists talked about the possibilities enabled by everyone having an 
internet connected, GPS enabled phone, this app was what they were talking 
about. Geo-locate the store you are at, unlock a pump and pay remotely. 
This app is a 5 star idea; what a shame it is a 1 star execution. First of 
all the initial set up is a nightmare. The lack of single signon means you 
have to register and validate an email address, set up a pin, and register 
a payment method (twice, because PayPal doesn't work). This process alone 
almost had me uninstalling the app. However as a motorbike rider the 
thought of not having to take off my helmet every time I filled up was 
still compelling, so I stuck with it. Unfortunately things just got worse. 
Even when the app works, it is so slow that you might as well have paid at 
the counter. As the only member of a group using this app on a road trip, I 
was often still at the pump waiting for the transaction to complete after 
my friends had filled up and paid. And that was *if* the app worked. The 
last transaction of the 4 I used this app for failed, meaning not only did 
I waste the time using the app, but then I was "that guy" who held everyone 
at the register up while a manual adjustment took place. For an app whose 
only feature is convenience, a 25% failure rate is ridiculous. Using this 
app is the consumer equivilant of being the monkey shot into space: you'll 
be amazed at the technology, you'll be awed at the possibilities, and 
you'll probably burn up on re-entry. The only reason to download this app 
today is to understand the phrase "testing in production". Otherwise come 
back in 2 years when the bugs have been resolved.

This was a good app until it asked me to re-enter my password. Ended up 
resetting that, then it asked me for my pin. Entered my pin which it said 
was incorrect and had to reset that. No time to do all this at the bowser, 
lucky it wasn't just me and baby in the car, hubby was with me and could go 
in to pay. This app needs to remember your login details and not force you 
to reset them!

I was hoping for more. Like the price of fuel at the stations, linking my 
velocity card. The map is useless in my opinion, why would I want pull 
over, turn my car off and search for a BP where I can say "Hey Google, 
where's the closest BP service station?" while driving.

The app works. Unlike some others have said, you don't have to enter your 
password and email address everytime. You can use it with just a 
fingerprint or a pin. But the real issue is how slow it is to open up the 
app and get to the stage where you're ready to fill up. For me, far quicker 
to go in-store. Speediness must be greatly improved.
It gives my opponent a blank screen.
the app is super slow. it's faster to walk to the counter.

Unable select pump no. I am using HTC M9. Have uninstalled it. Will re 
install and see how it goes. Has already emailed screen shots of the error 
pages.

Basically it didn't work for me two times now at different service stations. I did as told. Before fueling up I started app and locked the fuel pump. All good at this stage. It told me to fill up now but in both cases once done I had to go inside since the app was stuck in progressing state. Basically the person in the service station had to re-adjust the price between the bpme system and their pump. So it took me much longer than the normal way. For me this app is just not working. I think this is a classic case of developing an app for the sake of having an app. Why didn't you install pay & wave on the pump directly ? Just fill up wave your phone or card against the pump and you are done. For me the whole app BPME app concept is over-engineerd and over-thought. Please go back to the whiteboard and rethink. Just not working !!
Perhaps an app that's great in theory, sadly installs yet doesn't load/open.

Love the app and been using it for every time. The only issue I have 
experienced was the slowness on both unlocking the pump and finishing the 
payment. Several times it prompt the "payment done" page long after I

in the queue and paying at the shop, it would be less meaningful for using 
it.

Keeps telling me that the 4digit code is not correct, even though I have

Great idea, however the app so far isn't as user friendly as it could be

This app is too slow to be used at a petrol station. Quicker to pay at the

It Is fast a to pay in the shop than use this app. The app is also very

Faster to pay instore. Takes ages to load, and even longer to find that you're at the station. Doesn't tell you the prices which could have been a useful feature. Only works at a few locations. Keeps logging itself out when changing to another app or turning off the screen.

Poor interface. Very slow to load. Unreliable. The app crashed without

This is a really crappy app. Data doesn't sync in real-time so you have to

Concept is good if they can make it work

This is a great idea. However, you need to iron out a few issues. Issue #1 
The app should allow you to be able to cancel a pump/re-select a pump if 
you have selected the wrong pump. Believe it or not, it's quiet easy to get 
the number wrong since you have to make the selection in your car. The 
chances of you getting it wrong are increased. Since I couldn't change the 
pump, I had to pay for someone else's fuel And getting a refund was a 
mission. The staff are not even aware of how the BPme app works. Issue #2 
Sometimes the app loses connection half way through the process then it 
declines the transaction and you find out after driving off. You get a 
nasty $3 extra to the bill. Issue #3 You pay an extra $1-$3 for each 
transaction. Noticed this when I had to go in and check. Their system 
showed $86.54 I was charge $89.54 through PayPal. Maybe it's them covering 
the costs of using PayPal as the payment process. Suggestions You should be 
able to link this with the virgin frequent flyer scheme. I'm losing out on 
a lot of points as I only fill up here because of that reason. Have a 
fingerprint access so that login can be sped up a little bit. Or just speed 
up the processing for the app. If you can fix this, the app would be very 
convenient to use.
Pin and password?? Unusable!

Good app works well. The ability to print a receipt from the email would be

Love the idea but the app is rubbish and full of glitches! Cmon BP, spend some $$$ and get a good app!!!

content: The app is terribly slow. It has crashed or frozen 100% of the time I have used it. It all starts with a stupidly long welcome animation, then a long delay to "log in", and it gets stuck in "you don't seem to be near a station" when I am between three BP stations that are less than 350 m apart. Using the "Station Finder" does not allow me to select a station (instead it shows a map of Africa). The "Station Finder" shows petrol stations that are not BP's. If I "favourite" a station, it does not remember it. You can't register a Velocity card, you can't see the fuel prices to compare between different stations, it takes ages to log in and use (my phone locks in the time it takes to log in), in "Account" - there is no button to add a different payment method, you need to register a password AND security question AND a PIN AND a fingerprint - overkill for what should be a simple app. Really - I have yet to find anything in this app that works, functions or provides any benefit. Complete waste of time and effort and an utter disappointment.
replyContent:
Hi there,

We're sorry to hear you had this experience. We are looking into this further to understand what caused this. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes and we will pass this on to the developers.




Kind regards,

BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)

content: Very clunky app; this needs a complete makeover. I used this app to take advantage of an AMEX offer but it was so clunky I can't see myself using it again. Issues: set up took about 15 mins. It offered authentication via PayPal but the app just hung with a black screen. I then registered with a BP account. Authentication involved email verification, then challenge question, then PIN, and then it asked if I wanted to use fingerprint ID. Seriously! The app allows a search of service stations via GPS and map. While on the move, for some reason when I tried to centre the map it kept jumping to a previous location I had passed through. When I finally fill up with fuel, it asks for relevant details and tells me to proceed. After hanging up the pump there's no confirmation that all is OK so I go to the cashier who says it is all good. I then get a transaction error msg on the app but also an email confirming the billing. So I got my fuel and paid for it but what an awful experience. The concept is good but the app is extremely clunky.

content: That's it. I'm done with this app. As time goes on, it's either non-functional at worst or dysfunctional at best. Today's transaction was ridiculously slow. Won't send password reset. Won't send password reset text as it adds the incorrect country code and wont allow me to change it.

if you fill up first. you cannot pay via this app. left me at the station with only money in my paypal account and therefor no way to pay since BP dont have that ability in store. 2nd time i attempted to use it. 2nd time bp app failed to be usefyll. once again i have to go back and pay for the fuel i got today because they cant take paypal in store. only via app. BP youre bad at everything.

Absolutely terrible app. Login issues. Then when at the station, will not recognise the pump number to start a transaction. On principle, I will be going to competitor petrol stations as this is unacceptable.
efficient and really easy to use. perfect for parents with kids in the car, fantastic app!

Had worked great in the past.It was a god send. Yesterday I tried to fill up and the app just wouldnt work. I had two crying babies in the car I didnt have time to wait, at this stage it would be monumental to drag them inside to pay, so I left. looked at my bank today and I had been charged for trying to us the app. I didnt cancel these transaction it timed out becuase it was taking so long. Ikd if I'll use the app again now.
cannot login. password reset also not working. nothing works. useless app

pretty ridiculous..velocity members cant earn single point as they cant link velocity membership account with app.. poor app developement which obviously forgot abt velocity .. contact customer help they have no idea and passing balls to velocity instead of acknowledging their error..misleading promos. and very poor app..cant login most of the time
What the heck.. this app should be studied on how to not design apps classes. So many bugs.
Takes more minute while searching the petrol station and getting ready for payments. beside that I really happy with this APP. it saves time and energy.
slow and never works properly. Tried to use it again today and it just says an error occurred when trying to log in
easy friendly use
hasnt worked for a long time...keep checking but have to drive off as will not load/register pump

I've never seen more setup steps in my life. You have to register with PayPal, verify your email address, create a BP password, create a secret question, verify your phone number, setup a pin, configure fingerprint authentication, and accept a handful of random agreements and safety warnings. Once you're done it seems to work, although it's far from snappy. Lots of waiting for things to load.
Great app and it would get 5 stars if you could link your velocity card to it as well.
best app and saves me going in to pay
use fingerprint authentication, take more than a minute to login....then it show "something went wrong, please enter pin"
slow app but handy if ur lazy
very bad. it can only get rid of regular customers by NOT working most of the times. "Technical error" ?? really ?? 4 out of 5 times ??
Great app. allows me to full up without going into store to pay. Would have given five stars if it allowed you to link to velocity account.
no point using it when I can't earn velocity points. its the only reason I use BP. great idea for an app but just need the loyalty rewards brought into it

good thought behind the app and usage but whats the point if your transaction get cancelled and operater ask you to pay cash in store. or when as you trying to fill in, mid way app crashes. nearby BPme accepted store is Ringwood (vic) every 2nd time been they play this game. dont know if its app or store who does not allow this
the onboarding is stupid... register with paypal... and then sign in again with something else. why cant i just login with paypal?!
Not accepted at BP OTR which are the majority of stations in SA
never bloody works!
halfway through putting petrol in and the transaction gets cancelled. whats the point of having the option to pay by mobile then?

ca is n never log in
horrible app, does not work!!!!!
I cant log in. keeps redirecting me to main page after login details are asked and prompts to login again.
which app do i download to use my bp run cards

8/08/2019 Update: the app is still terribly slow and buggy making it really frustrating to use. The only reason I install this app is for the cashback offers provided by Amex. No one in their right mind would use this app as their method of payment, its almost as if the developers intentionally want to make it a nuisance to use this method, and instead forcing you to pay in store. My last experience with the app was so bad, I permanently switched to Shell Fuel.

content: What is the point of this app? If you want people to be able to pay without going inside, just put EFTPOS facilities on the bloody bowser. A lot more reliable than some stupid app that probably spies on you anyway (like just about all proprietary apps do). BP just want to look modern and "up with the times", even though there are better solutions that could be implemented. Technology is making us stupid. Ned Ludd where are you? We need you!
Never works, always has an error when attempting to select which pump.
Enormous pain to set up and then nothing even works. The map is blank and everything just shows a loading spinner. even tried it on Wi-Fi at home and it was the same.
One of the worst apps I have ever downloaded. Not fit for purpose.
Useless app, cannot get past login page

Since I upgraded to a Samsung Galaxy S10+ the app refuses to work. After I enter my PIN the loading circles just rotates ad infinitum. I now have to go back to leaving three kids under 5 in the car and risk returning to screeching.
As others have said, glitchy as. Pages won't load, can't select a station... Severely problematic.

Hi, app can be a bit slow.. Not sure if it's the clerk being slow or the communications side of the app. A suggestion, how about you also add an option for car profiles (car1, car2, car3) and add the option to enter the km from the odometer. Then send those along with the email receipt for us to keep track.
Station finder is useless - just gives a blank screen. I won't use this until my Velocity account can be added. Until then I will have to use the till in the shop.
Makes managing a business vehicle simple

If I could rate it 0 stars I would. Downloaded this app so I could pay at pump without having to take my baby out of the car. After the long and tedious registration process the app failed to 'locate' any servos! Complete waste of time and useless app. Won't be fueling up at BP anymore as this app was the only reason I'd gone there to begin with.

Fails in every way. Takes ages to set up. Doesn't work at major stations (eastlink) Map doesn't work for station finder. (protip, use list mode) 10 mins of driving later, get to a bpme station, pump 'failed to unlock, see staff inside.' Cars behind me getting impatient, had to wake baby to go inside anyway. Thanks, Zero stars.
The only countries flag that appears fir support is India's flag.
Easy to use and works well
Won't find location Garbage app
Fuelling and paying without leaving the car. Exactly what a Mum with a sleeping bub needs.
So easy! Great app.
Useless. Can't find or select a station...
Great concept, Poor performance. Takes way too long to load up to 5 minutes. Defeats the purpose.
I like the idea behind the app but it does have issues. Mainly, it's slow and the station finder doesn't work. Please fix this app.
Waste of time. Why make an app that doesn't work? So many negative reviews... Apps should be thoroughly tested before being allowed on the Play Store.
Takes a bit long to find a servo. Map find a servo doesn't woek at all. Cannot use bp card as form of payment. Once at the pump and servo has been located by the app, it all works really well.

Everything about this app is slow. Registration is slow. Login is slow. Location detection is slow. Pump selection is slow. Paying is slow. Unlocking pump is slow. Think about the context this app is used in: people are sitting in the forecourt holding up traffic. It should take no more than 10 seconds to open app and unlock pump. Any wait time beyond that is unacceptable. It's faster to just pay inside the store. And the app should *never* ask me to put my password in, ever.
Station finder shows no map. Expected better app quality from a large multinational.
Very slow, hense useless. The idea is great, the implementation is horrible. It is much quicker to walk and pay at the shop than using this app. Do not waste your time installing it.

If you create account then later login via oauth, it fails (bug). If you then login via password as instructed, it says oops server error even with correct pass. Amateur accounts management.... for me, account now effectively "broken". Expect better from major company.
Ever since I got a new phone it won't let me log in. Keeps giving me the error "something went wrong". Used to be super convenient when my kid was asleep in the car to pay for fuel.

userName: OMG Vegan Matrix Pill OMG lorne Beck loves it!!!

Slow, usually doesnt work.

replyContent:
Hi Ravi, 
Our app developers have advised that for a small number of mobile phone handsets such as yours, the app's software development kit (SDK) fails to initialise which may cause the app to crash. We are working with our developers to investigate this further and will share updated information as soon as it is fixed.

Easy to use. Fast and secure.
gret
Fuel stations near me are not listing . Map is not working . Not sure what is the use of this app.

Catastrophically useless app. I can get out of the car, hand pump the fuel and count out 5c pieces to manually pay before the app even identifies which pump I'm at! For an app like this, speed is crucial and this moves at a glacial pace. Tried at 4 different fuel stations at different times of day, even using different phones. All slow.
So easy to pay and go
Shame ...great idea but despite entering in so much sensitive personal information it does not work at all..! Waste of amex rebate offer! Uninstalled..

It takes more time to make payments using this app. And it is not even linked to velocity so we lose all those points and deals. I'd rather choose to pay over the counter.

All good

Garbage app. Can't get passed select pump request. Reviews generally suggest that app needs lots of work. Good idea but that is about it.
One of the worst app experience

Slow and kept crashing after logged in, on an Android phone. *Updates - This app simply continue to fail, I seriously didn't think it can go much worse, but it did. Slow crashes and now won't even connect at all. Wasting time and frustration especially when don't have cards to pay

I find this app very useful

Wonderful

Doesn't work at all.
The shittest app known to mankind! Diabolical 🖕

Drove out of my way for Amex promotion, and app wouldn't progress past payment option details, filled up and had to pay with card in store. Waste of time, Amex shouldnt promote, I should have just bought local cheaper petrol.
Great app

Absolutely awful. App doesn't load half the time and when it does, it's taken 10 minutes and you could have filled up your tank and paid for it in store TWICE already. I tried to use it tonight and it wouldnt load past the login screen but kept emailing me a verification code, even though I've used the app before and there wasn't anywhere to put a code because the stupid app wouldn't load. What a complete waste of time. Almost 10 minutes of mucking around and I still ended up paying in store.
Can't get passed the login verification.... disappointed

App useless,totally unusable,you log in and then have to enter a verification code,when you get the verification code from your email and go back to the app you have to start again in a never ending loop! Garbage!!!!
What a horrible app. Does not seem to load most of the time. App login everytime, so paraniod.

Takes longer to activate the pump that to fuel up and pay inside and leave when the app is performing at it's best. At it's worst you'll restart the app several times and wait long enough to fuel up 5 times over. Seriously speed needs to be worked on. I do like not having to go in and speak with anyone though.
Poorly designed and sloppy UI. Takes ages to load. Faster to pay in person. Pick your game up.
Horribly slow app, death by a thousand clicks, then barely any bp stations accept it

I don't usually go to the effort of writing reviews on apps but this desperately needs one. This app is next to useless. It takes forever to log you in, times out quickly and is very slow to use. This is all being experienced on an S10+, one of the highest spec phones available today. Very frustrating and desperately needs to be "revamped".
Clunky to use, can't even log in. It won't accept the email verification code. The experience needs to be faster. Its much faster to walk into the service station and pay!

An app should be intuitive or atleast outline the workflow. Turned on app, did that! Filled up car. App had loaded finally, selected bp location, pump, went to pay error! Went to kiosk, "ha! Ha! You have to select the pump before you fill sir!" Why didn't the app or the posters on the pump say that? What andy I a mind reader... obviously not.
Not bad

Without doubt the worst app I have ever downloaded. God help you if you can't remember your password. It is impossible to reset. Want to reset by SMS? Only an option if you have an Indian mobile number as you can't change the preset country code. Resetting by email? Okay, get an email which you have to click a link on, which sends another email with a verification code which you have to enter on the app, only to be taken back to the login page. Has the password reset? No. Hopeless.
Never ending verification process that fails every time...even uninstalled and reinstalled... same problem!!!
App is ok but excruciatingly slow

Easily the worst app i ever downloaded. Would give a 0 star if i could. Extremely slow. No explanation on its use at the start and so I missed out on my $10 cashback through amex. Do NOT download. Now they have my personal details.
Buggy and doesn't state you need to start the app before the fill. Will not be using this bpme app again, delete!
BP is good
The app is so slow to load every time that it's so much quicker to just go in and pay after filling. Not worth the time or effort to set it all up

Very clunky. Your "nearest" station will only come up when you are physically at the station you want to pump at. Don't try to use the app to navigate to the station, then select to use it... It doesn't work that way.

I don't normally rate apps but this useless one takes the cake and needs to be called out. Extremely slow when it does work so quicker to walk in and pay and heaven forbid if you need to reset your code. I have tried several times to do this over the last few months and have now given up. I managed to reset my pass code but when I tried to log in it kept showing invalid code. You would have thought with all the negative feedback about this BP would do something about it to fix it.
I can't even join. Worst app ever
Its very handy being about to pay when kids are in the car
Too slow to open
Fails with PayPal most of the time.
Unusable. It worked fine the first few times then inexplicably today stopped working. Uninstalled & reinstalled and still not working.

Cannot reset my password at all. I am giving one star because your Developers have clearly missed UX. After I enter the verification code it takes me back to the login page. How am I meant to login without an option prior to set a password
Love it. So good when you've gor kids!!
It is terrible app. I changed my phone and I tried to log in but it said went wrong. Try again. So I tried again and the app blocked my ID. And a lot of errors I got.. please make this app again.

Unlocked pump, got petrol but it says error, please restart again (i've done so so that i can pay, wouldnt want to steal fuel) turned out it unlocked the pump again for the next person while i was trying to settle at counter. CANT CANCEL PUMP!!! ended up paying for myself AND the next person through app and she doesnt have cash to pay me back. WORSE DAY OF MY LIFE! Petrol is expensive as it is and now I have to pay for other people because of a glitch in the friggin app.
replyContent: Hi Jacqueline, we’re so sorry to hear that you had this experience! Whilst you should take care to ensure that you have selected the correct pump when filling, we appreciate that accidents can happen 😊 if you’d care to email AUcustcare@bp.com we’d love to hear more about your experience. Thank you, BPme Support

content: It's a bit rubbish. Barely ever works and when it does it takes a really long time to do so!

I give up. I've literally got 12 emails in my inbox right now from trying to reset my password (which I had to do three times for the app to accept it, although obviously the system did register the change in password, because it wouldn't let me use the one I was trying to change it to) and then verify my account, only to fail to proceed past login. Seems like the issues I pointed out two years ago still exist - so I'm just not going to bother anymore.
Poor password reset...looks to nowhere

Why does it make me reverify my login EVERTIME I TRY TO LOGIN THE APP. I SELECTED THE OPTION TO NOT KEEP ASKING ME. Added CC. Says payment not able to be validated. Took 3 days to verify my card. Not a quick easy set-up. Cmon BP. You have billions. Couldn't afford a couple hundred thousand to help you save on staff costs at servos?

If you forget your password, need to send an email link. Sometimes takes ages to arrive. When it finally arrives, you get a link. Click on link, app asks you for verification that it is you. When email with verification finally arrives, you enter that and app takes you back to log in screen. After 5 cycles of this, I gave up. You can only reset the password by accessing email link on a computer. Not via phone app.
Garbage app
I hate this app it NEVER works successfully and is as slow as a wet week, keeps people waiting causing wait rage. It is quicker to queue and pay.
Easy and convenient. Enter my pin in the app, service station appears, select pump, fill and go. So easy especially when my children are in the car, I don't need to get them out.
Worst experience ever. Better to pay by card. Always slow.. constantly logs out. Good idea. Very bad execution.

Worked great for 3 months. Then just logged me out and wont let me log in no matter what i do. The reset passwords don't work. So frustrating. Ill use Caltex ! And while im at it...if im prepared to download the app and use BP exclusively SURELY they could give a few cents a litre discount... some incentive
S o S L O W, I spend as long waiting for app as I do for the fuel to be dispensed. No Velocity support.
Fails to log in almost all the time. Then if you get logged in almost always requires a fresh login on the next attempt to use. This makes it pretty much useless as a payment tool.

App is garbage. Poorly coded, constant errors, and has the tenacity to blame the users- yes, I inputted the phone number correctly, yes it's the right pump. The flickering of the screen as this app does anything, the flypast error web pages: BP is a multi billion dollar company- spend a few bucks more on your app before release or just add tap and go to the pumps, which Makes WAY more sense than this half assed jump on board the app train.
Absolute garbage app. Don't waste your time. Tried to setup account never got past enter verification. Completed 4 times....Easier to ditch the app.
Terrible app! After going through an insane amount of security steps, the app doesn't even tell you how much the fuel is at local stations. Absolutely useless. Uninstalled instantly.
Excessive login requirements ie. Verification code, confirming email, opening the app, etc.

Signup requires email, 10 character password, email verfication code, phone verification code, 4 digit pin, fingerprint, locarion and that's where I bailed. This app should be illegal and I'm guessing that it's the start of a marketing spam platform. Stay well away from it 😉
The app used to work perfectly with my Note8. It's never worked with my Note10+ please fix this issue. HEY APP DEVELOPERS PLEASE FIX THIS ISSUE. PLEASE
You are a billion dollar company. Sort this out. Thanks

content: Was Excellent and is now terrible and not usable. I used to love this app now l just keep going around in circles. Now time consuming and l rather go to a different servo altogether. I am a wheelchair user so it WAS a fantastic app that did make life easier. Now it is just stress inducing.

Oh my god my bank setup has less authentication than this. Calm down with all the verifying and coding

I was confused with the other BPMe App for Fleet cars - that I also installed thinking it was the "normal" BPMe App. Help.... I want to use this App.************************************************************ 10 April 2021...the same thing - as my previous comment is happening. Clear data, uninstalled, re-installed. Any update on fix for this?
replyContent:
Hi Maurice,
Thanks for letting us know straight away. Our app developers have advised that for a small number of mobile phone handsets such as yours, the app's software development kit fails to initialise which may cause the app to crash. We are working with our developers to patch this and will update users as soon as it is fixed.

content: On many occasions I have been to pay fuel and been asked to scan my app. The scanner has "beeped" however no transaction being recorded. I feel I have been "scammed" with no real transaction being recorded. I may as well go back to caltex and although paying slightly more on fuel at least the transactions are actually recorded.
replyContent: Hi Chandrahash, thank you for your review. BPme only records purchase history on the app if used for mobile transactions. If you’re using BPme to scan the digital rewards card, you won’t see the transaction summary. To see your points balance, as well as your BP Points transaction history login to bprewards.com.au.

content: last time I used the app to fuel, It didn't give me a tax invoice, required for tax purposes. There is no clear way to contact BP about this issue other than leaving a message here. The time before, it wouldn't unlock the pump, so I filled up at Caltex nearby, also using an app.
replyContent: Hi, BPme receipts are emailed to you at the time of the transaction in the form of a tax invoice. Please check your junk folder if you can't find them. Your transactions are also saved in BPme and can be viewed at any time. Go to ‘account’ and tap ‘view past transactions’. If you'd like to contact us, please send a note to aucustcare@bp.com.

content: Great

Started using this as a new mum so i didnt have to get my baby out to pay. So many errors, I stopped going to BP at all. Have consistently tried to log in for months but app keeps failing. The app is terrible and it makes me avoid BP just because it's annoying
Great

This app is incredibly buggy and unreliable. At least 70% of the time I need to go instore to confirm payments have gone through or it times out or it says no internet connection when there is one. Also be prepared for $1 test payments EVERY time you use the app. Keep hoping the app will improve but seems even buggier. 9/10 times I have to go in to the shop to make sure the app has worked. Can wait up to 5-10 minutes for a receipt to come through.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. The $1 you refer to, whenever you load a payment type into your BPme wallet or use BPme’s Pay for Fuel functionality, a $1 pre autho amount is held & refunded 3-10 days (depends on your bank).This is a card validation & security measure. Notification will appear in BPme app. Further info, you can head to the BPme website.

content: The app works well enough mostly. However if you need support forget it. Emails go unanswered and phone calls on the number provided go unanswered. I was left on hold from Millmerran to Toowoomba. Customer support is non-existent.

Be prepared to login, this app is forever asking you to login so basically make sure you login before your journey don't try and use it at the pump as login takes forever and then you have to await a code. I am yet to have an easy experience that I have not prepared fir a day ahead and checked again it is logged in the day of departure. I have now created multiple accounts and they just add more ways to log in ...

Downloaded to use in NZ and it requires an Aussie phone number. Heaps of errors, uninstalled right away. Such a shame as I really wanted to use it to order coffee. Will find another coffee shop whose app actually works.
MOTHERS - pay at pump does not work! This app. is ABSOLUTE RUBBISH. Giant waste of time
Took a while to get it to work but ok now. Saves a lot of walking
It would be helpful if the staff unlocked the pumps and then finalised the transactions in a timely matter. It takes just as long to use the app as it does to walk into the store.
replyContent:
Hi Michelle,
For the initial BPme launch, we have introduced the fuel payment function to help customers save time. You can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Watch this space for new BPme features in the future.
